subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 03 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Whelan may sue West Ham & League
Wigan's Dave Whelan may sue the Premier League and West Ham after the saga of the transfers of Javier Mascherano and Carlos Tevez.



 
Shevchenko to have groin surgery
Chelsea striker Andriy Shevchenko is to have surgery on a groin injury at the end of the season.



 
Wenger fined and censured by FA
Arsene Wenger is fined and severely censured by the Football Association for comments he made after the Carling Cup final.








GOLF




Wachovia Ch'ship leaderboard
Leading scores from the first round in North Carolina.



 
In-form Backstrom sets Milan pace
Swede Joakim Backstrom fires a stunning 10-under-par 62 in the first round of the Italian Open.



 
Italian Open leaderboard
Latest updates from the European Tour event in Milan.








MOTORSPORT




Second crash at Spanish GP track
Williams' Nico Rosberg is unhurt in the second high-speed crash at the Circuit de Catalunya this week.



 
Fogarty team confirms 2008 return
Carl Fogarty's team will return to the World Superbikes championship in 2008 using Agusta bikes.



 
F1 races still boring - Briatore
Renault team boss Flavio Briatore says changes aimed at livening up Formula One have not worked.








FORMULA ONE




Second crash at Spanish GP track
Williams' Nico Rosberg is unhurt in the second high-speed crash at the Circuit de Catalunya this week.



 
F1 races still boring - Briatore
Renault team boss Flavio Briatore says changes aimed at livening up Formula One have not worked.



 
Button 'wants to stay at Honda'
Jenson Button has no plans to leave struggling F1 team Honda, according to his manager.








ATHLETICS




Back injury frustrates Radcliffe
Paula Radcliffe is unlikely to defend her World Athletics Championships marathon title because of a back problem.



 
Back injury for Aikines-Aryeetey
World Junior 100m champion Harry Aikines-Aryeetey returns to London after suffering a back injury during training in the United States.



 
Mason jumps to shock win in Dakar
Germaine Mason wins the high jump at the IAAF World Athletics Tour event in Senegal.








CYCLING




GB is top cycling nation - King
British Cycling boss Peter King says this country's riders are the best in the world and will be GB's best hopes of Olympic gold.



 
Under-fire Basso parts with team
Ivan Basso quits the Discovery Channel team after an investigation into his role in a Spanish doping scandal is reopened.



 
Di Luca up for Giro after big win
Danilo Di Luca is looking forward to challenging for glory in May's Giro d'Italia after victory in the Liege-Bastogne-Liege race.








FUN AND GAMES




Comment: Don't blame the fixtures
Robbo says the lack of a Keane-type player cost Man Utd in Milan



 
Lawrence Dallaglio talks to Chris Evans
Wasps star Lawrence Dallaglio talks to Chris Evans about the Heineken Cup final, his shed and his dog attempting to eat his children's friends! Evans and sidekick Jonny Saunders have a different sporting guest every evening on their Radio 2 show.
